results.title: The Middle Ages
results.creator_credit: Polonius Film Services and John Dooley
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
History of the Middle Ages from Charlemagne examined through art, monasteries, agriculture and invasions. Illustrated by 15th century miniatures, the film gives a good background to European history, literature and art.

results.title: The Microscopy of opaque objects
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, Alex Strasser and Denys Parsons
results.brief_description: Materials such as plastics, leather, metals and textiles are opaque and must therefore be illuminated from above, Various methods of illumination are discussed; the direct method for very low-power work; the use of the simple vertical illuminator; the built-in vertical illuminator and the catoptric lens. The methods of operation are also explained.

results.title: The Microscope
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, John Taylor and Alex Strasser
results.brief_description: This film is designed for upper secondary and tertiary students of biology, medicine etc. Its purpose is to encourage the efficient and careful use of microscopes. The parts of the microscope, the correct way to set it up and the routine of procedure for high-power work are explained.

results.title: The Microphone
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the structure, and the functioning, of both the primitive and the improved types of carbon and ribbon microphones, as well as an analysis of the ribbon microphone and its use in a film studio.

results.title: The microcircuit story / presented by Philips
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: The basic principles involved in the manufacture of microcircuits, such as epitaxial growth, diffusion, and the masking process are illustrated, as are some of their diverse applications in everyday life, eg. the control of machine tools, colour television, navigation of aircraft, etc.

results.title: The Mick Fleetwood story: Two sticks and a drum
results.creator_credit: Creatvty, Jason Wright and Richard Journo
results.brief_description: Informative and reasonably honest account of the life of Mick Fleetwood, drummer and leader of the legendary rock band Fleetwood Mac. Utilising stills, archival footage and a slew of interviews both with Fleetwood and his contemporaries, this work elucidates the incredible immoderation of a successful rock musician’s life. Drink, drugs, women, limousines, jet planes, extensive travelling parties, money — in short, excess of just about everything that is a feature of the lifestyle. Fleetwood admits the drugs were nearly his undoing as well as the (well documented) shifting relationships in the band and the claustrophobic environment of relentless touring and recording. Interviewees include: Lindsay Buckingham, Stevie Nicks and Christine McVie.

results.title: The Michael Nyman songbook
results.creator_credit: Bioskop Film, Decca, Hessischer rundfunk and Arte, Eberhard Junkersdorf and Volker Schlondorff
results.brief_description: Michael Nyman conducts his own band and vocalist Ute Lemper in a program of popular songs of his own composition based on the texts of poet Paul Celan, Mozart, Rimbaud plus the piece entitled “Miranda” from the film “Prospero’s Books.” Recorded live at the Musikhalle, Hamburg, 1992.

results.title: The Micallef programme [Series 2: episodes 1 - 3]
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Shaun Micallef, Gary McCaffrie and Ted Emery
results.brief_description: Lawyer turned comedian Shaun Micallef presents his own unique brand of humor in a series of sketches from his program along with fellow comedians Francis Greenslade, Wayne Hope and Roz Hammond. Items from three separate episodes include; Bud Smallhorn, passionate flag maker at the Old Glory Banner Company; Sexpo; Mark Wainwright, blind climber of Mt Everest; the politeness distance indicator; District Attorney Ferguson; Australia’s first male Miss Nude Australia; police corruption; farewelling a valued audience member; Dracula who wants to escape the rat race; meals on wheels; the search for the best laundry detergent and the Australian record domino attempt. Guests/special appearances by Tim Rogers, Kevin Harrington and Glenn Robbins.

results.title: The Miami experiment
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Brian Blake
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An American defence lawyer argues that his 15 year-old client is not guilty of murder. The plea is insanity, caused by exposure to television violence. The trial is the first major trial to be televised live during the proceedings. The case for and against this radical experiment is examined. A landmark use of television cameras inside a courtroom…an interesting overview and outcome from 1976. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Mexican [DVD]
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Newmarket Capital Group, Lawrence Bender, John Baldecchi and Gore Verbinski
results.brief_description: The Mexican is a blend of the caper film and the romantic comedy. Jerry Welbach (Brad Pitt), a rather goofy, inept lackey, is sent to Mexico to retrieve a prized, ancient gun, and return it to his boss, Nayman (Bob Balaban). Although this kind of work places a great strain on his relationship with Samantha Barzel (Julia Roberts), a highly strung, impetuous woman, who got in the way of his previous job, Jerry has no choice but to do this one final task. Samantha rejects this ultimatum and decides to leave her fiancee because of his “selfishness”. So, Jerry goes to Mexico and Samantha heads to Las Vegas, where she intends to become a waitress. Whilst Jerry’s adventure in Mexico is full of surprises and detours, Samantha is taken hostage by a hitman, Leroy (James Gandolfini), with whom she develops a strong friendship. Stereotypes about Mexicans and life “south of the border” abound, providing a backdrop for Brad and Julia. James Gandolfini injects much needed energy and charisma into the film, and the scenes between him as a cold-blooded killer providing advice on relationships to Julia are its most convincing and affecting.
